intro: Lipozygis tenella var. pilosovillosa, commonly known as the silky-haired lipozygis, is a rare and lesser-known plant species characterized by its unique foliage and floral structure. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. The plant is distinguished by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a soft, velvety appearance. Its small, clustered flowers typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow, adding to its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
